newsitem.title: FINLAND: FORECAST-Rauma Q1 profit seen down on Jan-April 96.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Rauma Q1 profit seen down on Jan-April 96.

text.p: A Reuters survey of analysts covering Finnish equities showed a 155 million markka median forecast for Finnish engineering group Rauma Oy's first quarter 1997 profit before extraordinary items and tax.
(Profit forecasts by 11 analysts, EPS by nine analysts).
Rauma's results are due on May 6 at 0800/0500 GMT.
The company switched this year to quarterly reporting from tertials. In January-April 1996, Rauma had a 271 million markka profit before extraordinary items and tax.

For the company's full-year 1997 profit, 10 of the analysts polled gave a median forecast of 711 million markka (mean 699 million) in a 524-794 million markka range. Rauma's 1996 profit was 679 million markka.

Contributors to the survey were ABB Aros Securities, AG Private Bankers, Aktia Bank, BZW Securities, Carnegie Securities, Den Danske Bank, Enskilda Securities, Erik Selin, Handelsbanken, Kleinwort Benson and Williams de Broe.
